intro: Lacinaria spicata f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered spiky lichen, is a rare and unique variant of the lichen species Lacinaria spicata. It is characterized by its distinctive white or pale-colored apothecia, which contrast sharply with the typical green or brown hues of its parent species. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on the bark of trees or on rocky surfaces in temperate regions. Its morphology includes a dense, spiky growth pattern that aids in water retention and protection from herbivores. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
